body.text:
General:
* Webex Teams supports Adaptive Cards 1.2.
* All card elements are available for use except `Media`.
* The following card properties are not supported yet: `Action.ToggleVisibility` for "Action" and "ActionSet" elements, `height` for "ColumnSet", and the card level attributes: `fallbackText`, `fallback`, `requires`, `speak`, and `verticalContentAlignment`.
* Cards may include up to five actions.
* Messages with Cards may include up to 10 images.
* Only one card can be sent per request.
* The card’s content cannot be changed after it’s created.
* You can use the [Buttons and Cards Designer](https://developer.webex.com/buttons-and-cards-designer) to design your Cards.

After a button click:
* Since the content of a Card cannot be changed after it's created, you could instead remove the card and post a message with the result of the action. To remove a card, simply delete the message that contains the card attachment. The card will be removed from the space.
* In cases where deleting the card is not feasible, such as in a group space where you want multiple people to interact with the Card, you could send each user a 1:1 message after they've interacted with it, or post a reply telling users that you already have their input for this card.
As always, engage your company's data protection team to understand if any of the data you're bot will be collecting triggers applicable regulatory or compliance requirements.
